The ideas behind my play in this game are very simple. Starting with this move - I simply place the bishop on a diagonal that may be useful in attacking the king later.

Developing. Better than Nge2 because I can now use Ng5 square to attack the king.

black's counter attack. I see that the pawns are too far away to threaten my knight right away..hence i begin expanding making threats of my own.

This move is troublesome because if the black bishop takes my white bishop...my queen will be displaced from line of fire :P  (i.e. the c1 - h6 diagonal). Hence, i have to take the bishop first but I still have time to do some damage on the king side.
